intro: Hypochaeris uniflora, commonly known as the singleflower weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and has been introduced to various regions around the world. The plant is characterized by its single, showy yellow flower atop a slender stem, often with a few small leaves along the stem. It typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily. Hypochaeris uniflora is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and environmental conditions.
